CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 7, 1950, pg. 4, reads: "Accused of Murder - Frank Robinson, 55, of Thirtieth Street, South Side, is accused of murdering his wife by homicide authorities who say he has admitted firing the shotgun blast which tore a hole in her right cheek. Mrs. Irene Robinson was found by neighbors almost twenty-four hours after the slaying took place, police said.  Robinson is shown being led from the coroner's offices Tuesday while Deputy Coroner J. Wentz and other attaches look on. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Murder suspect Frank Robinson being led through door of corner's office
